intro: Agoseris longirostris, commonly known as the long-beaked agoseris, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces yellow flowers with a distinctive elongated shape. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as meadows and rocky areas. Agoseris longirostris is often found in California and is adapted to thrive in arid environments.
